moves.1. e4: The standard opening of masters in simuls everywhere, trying for an open game they can quickly win.
moves.3. Nd2: Kmoch takes a slow approach, keeping the way clear for P-QB3 to support his QP.
moves.3... c5: The amateur tries to crack Kmoch's center immediately.
moves.4... cxd4: Opting to liquidate the center at once.
moves.7. Bg5: Developing with a pin. But Ellison will have none of that...
moves.7... Qa5+: ...as he unpins with a check, and sets a subtle trap. White's correct response is 8 Q-Q2! [If Black then plays 8... B-N5, White can play 9 P-QB3, sealing the diagonal.]
moves.8. Bd2: Kmoch makes a horrible blunder with this natural-looking response.
moves.8... Qe5: Ellison pounces. Kmoch resigns, as there is no way to avoid the outright loss of a piece.
